text: Instead of passing legislation to help people who are barely hanging on to their homes, Senate Republicans prioritized one thing these past few months: confirming more Trump judges. https://www.wsj.com/articles/struggling-rental-market-could-usher-in-next-american-housing-crisis-11603791000?mod=itp_wsj&ru=yahoo

Remember when we acknowledged Equal Pay Day for women back in April? Well, today is *finally* Latina Equal Pay Day, which marks the day that Latinas finally catch up to what their white male counterparts earned in 2019.

It’s long past time that we end the gender pay gap.
We need to restore the full protections of the Voting Rights Act in America. There’s no question about that.

8 years ago, Superstorm Sandy devastated our state. From the Jersey Shore to riverside communities, New Jerseyans lost their lives, their homes & their livelihoods—and many are still recovering. We have more work to do to build a more resilient NJ in the face of future storms.

Donald Trump is spewing falsehoods that downplay the severity of COVID-19 and doing all he can to distract Americans from his failed pandemic response. But no matter his ignorance, shamelessness, or lies, @HHSgov and @CDCgov must act to protect public health.

It’s critical that we understand the reason for these excess death numbers, especially in young adults and people of color. We need to know if they were caused by misclassified COVID-19 deaths or deaths related to not seeking or having access to medical care during this pandemic.

227,000 Americans are dead from COVID-19. But @CDCgov just released data showing another 100,000 deaths may have been directly or indirectly caused by the pandemic. We want to know what CDC & @HHSgov are doing about these shocking threats to life & health.
https://www.cnn.com/2020/10/29/health/covid-excess-deaths-senators-letter/index.html

RT @SenTinaSmith You might be thinking that there is a national effort to track how schools are reopening in person so we can reopen as many as possible safely.  

There is not. 
 
Betsy DeVos dropped the ball on this and @SenWarren and I are pushing back. Here's how. [THREAD]

Corruption spews out of the Trump White House, and it’s easy to become numb to it all. But take a look at my report. No one is above the law. We must enforce anti-corruption laws that protect our democracy, and we must have a President who adheres to them. https://www.warren.senate.gov/newsroom/press-releases/warren-releases-new-report-lawlessness-and-disorder-the-corrupt-trump-administration-has-made-a-mockery-of-the-hatch-act

Despite these repeated and flagrant Hatch Act violations, Trump administration officials have not faced any meaningful consequences. Again and again, the President’s friends and allies have misused their public positions and broken the law because they believe they are above it.

Secretary of State @SecPompeo is under investigation right now by @US_OSC for filming a speech that aired during the @GOP Convention while on an official trip to Israel. He also pledged on @FoxNews to use his office for partisan games before the election. https://thehill.com/homenews/administration/522755-office-of-special-counsel-widens-pompeo-probe-into-hatch-act

Trump’s daughter/advisor @IvankaTrump has had multiple complaints filed against her for repeatedly violating the Hatch Act with her political tweets and campaign travel. @US_OSC is still investigating – but so far, there have been 0 consequences.
https://www.citizensforethics.org/reports-investigations/crew-investigations/ivanka-trump-violated-the-hatch-act-eight-times-in-just-over-48-hours/

Former aide @KellyannePolls is the worst Hatch Act offender. Her violations were so egregious that the @US_OSC recommended her removal from office. But Trump wouldn’t do that. And Conway mocked the law, saying: “Let me know when the jail sentence starts.”
https://www.citizensforethics.org/news/press-releases/conway-twitter-violated-hatch-act-50-times/

The corruption starts at the top. Trump’s Chief of Staff, AG, Secretary of State, 8 other cabinet secretaries, top officials and family members have been accused of or found to have engaged in political activities on the taxpayers’ dime.

Under Trump’s watch, the @US_OSC has found that 14 administration officials have violated the Hatch Act over 50 times. At least another 22 more top Trump officials are presently under investigation for nearly 100 more Hatch Act violations. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/ElhLuzNXEAw5tQ4.png

Trump and his team have made a mockery of our ethics laws and turned the federal government into his own partisan campaign arm. I have a new 22-page report on the lawlessness of the most corrupt administration in US history. Here’s what I found:
https://www.boston.com/news/politics/2020/10/29/elizabeth-warren-trump-hatch-act-violations
I’ll be talking with @JimBraude and @MargeryEagan on @BosPublicRadio around 1:30 PM ET today. I hope you'll tune in! https://www.wgbh.org/news/boston-public-radio

I’m proud to be in this fight alongside my friend @SenWhitehouse. The way I see it, when the powerful dark money groups and the institutions they control are attacking you, you’re doing something right. https://twitter.com/SenWhitehouse/status/1321573981774905344 QT @SenWhitehouse My fight to expose the dark money smothering our political and judicial systems is not popular with the big special interests that have the most to lose.
